author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Anna Karenina
description: Set in 19th-century Russia, 'Anna Karenina' follows Anna's affair with Count Vronsky, leading to her social downfall. Alongside, it delves into the rural life of landowner Levin, exploring themes of love, marriage, and the pursuit of happiness.

author: Gustave Flaubert
title: Madame Bovary
description: Madame Bovary: Emma, married to a dull doctor, seeks passion through affairs and luxury, spiraling into ruin and despair.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: War and Peace
description: A novel set in Napoleonic times delves into the lives of five aristocratic families amid war, love, and personal quests, blending history with their stories.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
description: In 1922 Long Island, a wealthy enigma obsesses over a former debutante, revealing the dark underbelly of the Jazz Age's American dream in a tale of excess, moral decay, and tragic outcomes.

author: George Eliot
title: Middlemarch
description: Set in 19th-century Middlemarch, the novel delves into societal intricacies through Dorothea Brooke, idealistic, and Tertius Lydgate, an ambitious doctor. Their tales intersect with other townsfolk, exploring love, ambition, and moral quandaries, offering deep insights into human nature.
